Inside Macintosh: Networking With Open Transport / Part 2 - Open Transport Reference
Chapter 27 - Utilities Reference / Functions
Memory Manipulation Utility Functions /

OTMemzero

Initializes the specified memory range to 0.

C INTERFACE
void OTMemzero      (void* dest,
                     size_t nBytes)
C++ INTERFACE
None. C++ applications use the C interface to this function.

PARAMETERS
dest
A pointer to a memory location whose contents you are zeroing out.
nBytes
The number of bytes of memory you want to zero out.
SEE ALSO
Use the OTMemset function to set memory to a value other than 0.
